data.chText: 注意
data.enText: paying attention

data.chText: 注意；理会；察觉
data.enText: the fact of sb paying attention to sb/sth or knowing about sth

data.chText: 别在意你在报上看到的东西。
data.enText: Don't take any notice of what you read in the papers.

data.chText: 别理会他说的话。
data.enText: Take no notice of what he says.

data.chText: 这些抗议活动确实引起了政府的警觉和注意。
data.enText: These protests have really made the government sit up and take notice (= realize the importance of the situation) .

data.chText: 是苏珊使我注意到这个问题的。
data.enText: It was Susan who brought the problem to my notice (= told me about it) .

data.chText: 通常情况下，我是不会看到这封信的。
data.enText: Normally, the letter would not have come to my notice (= I would not have known about it) .

data.chText: 你肯定会注意到公司已经发生了一些重大的变化。
data.enText: It will not have escaped your notice that there have been some major changes in the company.

data.chText: 通报信息
data.enText: giving information

data.chText: 通告；布告；通知
data.enText: a sheet of paper giving written or printed information, usually put in a public place

data.chText: 布告牌上有一则通知说这堂课取消了。
data.enText: There was a notice on the board saying the class had been cancelled.

data.chText: 公告牌；警示牌
data.enText: a board or sign giving information, an instruction or a warning

data.chText: 写着“勿踏草地”的公告牌
data.enText: a notice saying ‘Keep off the Grass’

data.chText: 宣布
data.enText: announcing sth

data.chText: 启事；声明
data.enText: a small advertisement or announcement in a newspaper or magazine

data.chText: 出生喜报、结婚启事和讣告
data.enText: notices of births, marriages and deaths

data.chText: 通知
data.enText: a short announcement made at the beginning or end of a meeting, a church service, etc.

data.chText: 本周只有两项通知。
data.enText: There are just two notices this week.

data.chText: 警告
data.enText: warning

data.chText: 预告；警告
data.enText: information or a warning given in advance of sth that is going to happen

data.chText: 你必须一个月前发出通知。
data.enText: You must give one month's notice .

data.chText: 价格变动不另行通知。
data.enText: Prices may be altered without notice.

data.chText: 酒吧停止营业，直到另行通知。
data.enText: The bar is closed until further notice (= until you are told that it is open again) .

data.chText: 只要你及时通知，我们都欢迎你来住宿。
data.enText: You are welcome to come and stay as long as you give us plenty of notice.

data.chText: 辞职；搬迁
data.enText: when leaving job/house

data.chText: 辞职信；搬迁通知
data.enText: a formal letter or statement saying that you will or must leave your job or house at the end of a particular period of time

data.chText: 他递交了辞呈。
data.enText: He has handed in his notice .

data.chText: 他们通知她两周后搬走。
data.enText: They gave her two weeks' notice .

data.chText: 书评；剧评
data.enText: review of book/play

data.chText: （报刊上对书籍、戏剧等的）评论，短评
data.enText: a short article in a newspaper or magazine, giving an opinion about a book, play, etc.
at short notice
at a moment's notice

data.chText: 随时；一经通知立即；没有准备时间
data.enText: not long in advance; without warning or time for preparation

data.chText: 这是我们临时能弄到的最好的房间了。
data.enText: This was the best room we could get at such short notice.

data.chText: 你必须随时准备出发。
data.enText: You must be ready to leave at a moment's notice.
on short notice

data.chText: 通常不用于进行时
data.enText: not usually used in the progressive tenses

data.chText: 看到；听到
data.enText: see/hear

data.chText: 看（或听）到；注意到；意识到
data.enText: to see or hear sb/sth; to become aware of sb/sth

data.chText: 我首先注意到的是这屋子里的气味。
data.enText: The first thing I noticed about the room was the smell.

data.chText: 人们在跟他开玩笑，但他好像没有理会。
data.enText: People were making fun of him but he didn't seem to notice.

data.chText: 我一眼就看出她戴着假发。
data.enText: I couldn't help noticing (that) she was wearing a wig.

data.chText: 你有没有注意到雷切尔在不停地看她的手表？
data.enText: Did you notice how Rachel kept looking at her watch?

data.chText: 我注意到他们进来了。

data.hoverText: 动词+名词短语+不带to的不定式

data.enText: I noticed them come in.

data.chText: 我没看到他离开。
data.enText: I didn't notice him leaving.

data.chText: 注意
data.enText: pay attention

data.chText: 注意；留意
data.enText: to pay attention to sb/sth

data.chText: 她穿那些奇装异服不过是想引人注意而已。
data.enText: She wears those strange clothes just to get herself noticed.

data.text: notice ♦ note ♦ detect ♦ observe ♦ witness ♦ perceive

data.chText: 以上各词均含看到、注意到之义。
data.enText: These words all mean to see sth, especially when you pay careful attention to it.
notice

data.chText: 指看（或听）到、注意到、意识到、注意、留意：
data.enText: to see, hear or become aware of sb/sth; to pay attention to sb/sth

data.chText: 我首先注意到的是这屋子里的气味。
data.enText: The first thing I noticed about the room was the smell.
note

data.chText: 指注意、留意：
data.enText: ( rather formal ) to notice or pay careful attention to sth

data.chText: 请注意办事处星期一将关闭。
data.enText: Please note (that) the office will be closed on Monday.

data.chText: 该词在商务英语中非常通用：
data.enText: This word is very common in business English.

data.chText: 注意这些价格含增值税。
data.enText: Note that the prices are inclusive of VAT.
detect

data.chText: 指发现、查明、侦察出：
data.enText: to discover or notice sth, especially sth that is not easy to see, hear, etc.

data.chText: 这些检查旨在早期查出疾病。
data.enText: The tests are designed to detect the disease early.
observe

data.chText: 指看到、注意到、观察到：
data.enText: ( formal ) to see or notice sb/sth

data.chText: 最近你注意到什么变化没有？
data.enText: Have you observed any changes lately?

data.chText: 警察注意到一个男人走进了银行。
data.enText: The police observed a man enter the bank.
witness

data.chText: 指当场看到、目击：
data.enText: ( rather formal ) to see sth happen

data.chText: 警方呼吁目击这一事件的人与他们联系。
data.enText: Police have appealed for anyone who witnessed the incident to contact them.
perceive

data.chText: 指注意到、意识到、察觉到：
data.enText: ( formal ) to notice or become aware of sth, especially sth that is not obvious

data.chText: 我注意到他的举止在那几个月里有些改变。
data.enText: I perceived a change in his behaviour over those months.
to notice/note/detect/observe/perceive that/how/what/where/who…
to notice/observe/witness sth happen/sb do sth
to barely/hardly/scarcely notice/detect/observe
to be commonly/frequently noticed/noted/observed
to be worth noticing/noting/observing
sb can't/couldn't help noticing/noting/observing

simple_means.memory_skill: not 知道 + ice 表行为 → 使知道；做标记引起注意 → 注意；通知

ex.chText: 学生们全神贯注地听老师讲课。
ex.enText: The students paid close attention to the teacher's lecture.

ex.chText: 他的注意力其实不在比赛上。
ex.enText: His attention wasn't really on the game.

synonyms.bx: 指认真地听、看、思考等时的专注。

ex.chText: 你必须注意人们怎么说。
ex.enText: You must take heed of what people say.

ex.chText: 她根本没有理会他的警告。
ex.enText: She paid no heed to his warning.

synonyms.bx: 指对他人的意见、建议、警告等的重视或考虑，常和 give/pay/take等动词搭配使用。

ex.enText: Please take note of what I say.

ex.chText: 人们开始注意到他的歌唱才能。
ex.enText: People were beginning to take note of his talents as a singer.

synonyms.bx: 常用于 take note (of sth) 结构中，以表示注意到某事物并将其铭记在心。

ex.chText: 他的新书引起了公众对他的注意。
ex.enText: His new book brought him to public notice.

synonyms.bx: 指对所见、所闻的人或事物作出的反应，侧重结果。

ex.zh: 预先通知；发出解雇通知；递交辞呈

data.enText: at short notice
at a moment's notice

data.chText: 随时；一经通知立即；没有准备时间
data.enText: not long in advance; without warning or time for preparation

data.chText: 这是我们临时能弄到的最好的房间了。
data.enText: This was the best room we could get at such short notice.

data.chText: 你必须随时准备出发。
data.enText: You must be ready to leave at a moment's notice.
on short notice

tr: the act of noticing or paying attention
example: he escaped the notice of the police
his hard work soon attracted the teacher's notice

tr: an announcement containing information about an event
example: you didn't give me enough notice

tr: a sign posted in a public place as an advertisement
example: a poster advertised the coming attractions
the notification stated the grace period and the penalties for defaulting

tr: advance notification (usually written) of the intention to withdraw from an arrangement of contract
example: we received a notice to vacate the premises
he gave notice two months before he moved

tr: make or write a comment on
example: he commented the paper of his colleague

tr: express recognition of the presence or existence of, or acquaintance with
example: He never acknowledges his colleagues when they run into him in the hallway
She acknowledged his complement with a smile
it is important to acknowledge the work of others in one's own writing
She noted that someone was following her

tr: discover or determine the existence, presence, or fact of
example: She detected high levels of lead in her drinking water
We found traces of lead in the paint

value.def: If you notice something or someone, you become aware of them.

example.ex: People should not hesitate to contact the police if they've noticed anyone acting suspiciously...
example.tran: 如果发现形迹可疑的人，应该马上报警。

example.ex: I noticed that most academics were writing papers during the summer...
example.tran: 我注意到大部分学者暑期都在写论文。

example.ex: Luckily, I'd noticed where you left the car...
example.tran: 幸运的是我注意到了你把车停在哪里。

example.ex: Mrs Shedden noticed a bird sitting on the garage roof...
example.tran: 谢登夫人注意到一只鸟落在车库顶上。

example.ex: She needn't worry that he'll think she looks a mess. He won't notice.
example.tran: 她不必担心自己在他眼里显得不修边幅，他根本不会注意。

value.def: A notice is a written announcement in a place where everyone can read it.

example.ex: Notices in the waiting room requested that you neither smoke nor spit...
example.tran: 候车室的公告牌要求人们不要吸烟和随地吐痰。

example.ex: A few guest houses had 'No Vacancies' notices in their windows.
example.tran: 有几家旅社在窗户上贴出了“客满”的告示。

example.ex: ...a notice which said 'Beware Flooding'.
example.tran: 写有“小心山洪”字样的告示牌

value.def: If you give notice about something that is going to happen, you give a warning in advance that it is going to happen.

example.ex: Interest is paid monthly. Three months' notice is required for withdrawals...
example.tran: 利息按月支付。提款须提前3个月通知银行。

example.ex: Unions are required to give seven days' notice of industrial action...
example.tran: 工会组织劳工行动应提前7天作出声明。

example.ex: She was transferred without notice.
example.tran: 她事先没接到通知就被调走了。

value.def: A notice is a formal announcement in a newspaper or magazine about something that has happened or is going to happen.

example.ex: I rang The Globe with news of Blake's death, and put notices in the personal column of The Times...
example.tran: 我给环球剧院打电话告知了布莱克的死讯，然后在《泰晤士报》的私人广告栏登了讣告。

example.ex: The request is published in notices in today's national newspapers.
example.tran: 这一请求刊登在今天全国各大报纸的启事栏里。

value.def: A notice is one of a number of letters that are similar or exactly the same which an organization sends to people in order to give them information or ask them to do something.

example.ex: Bonus notices were issued each year from head office to local agents...
example.tran: 分红通告每年由总公司发送至地方代理商。

example.ex: There will be a creditors meeting on June 15 and notices will be circulated to all known creditors.
example.tran: 6月15号有一个债权人会议，通告将送达所有已知的债权人。

value.tran: (机构发送给相关人员的)通告

value.def: A notice is a written article in a newspaper or magazine in which someone gives their opinion of a play, film, or concert.

example.ex: Nevertheless, it's good to know you've had good notices, even if you don't read them.
example.tran: 不过，即便你不看，知道有一些对你的好评也挺好。

value.tran: (报刊上关于戏剧、电影或音乐会的)短评，评论

value.def: Notice is used in expressions such as 'at short notice', 'at a moment's notice' or 'at twenty-four hours' notice', to indicate that something can or must be done within a short period of time.

example.ex: There's no one available at such short notice to take her class...
example.tran: 只提前这么短的时间通知，找不到人替她的课。

example.ex: All our things stayed in our suitcase, as if we had to leave at a moment's notice.
example.tran: 我们的东西都放在手提箱里，好像我们一经通知就得马上离开。

value.tran: 随时/接到通知后立即/提前24小时通知

value.def: If you bring something to someone's notice, you make them aware of it.

example.ex: I am so glad that you have brought this to my notice...
example.tran: 我很高兴你让我注意到了这件事情。

example.ex: It was in 1982 that his name was first brought to our notice.
example.tran: 他的名字第一次引起我们注意是在1982年。

value.tran: 引起(某人)对…的注意;使(某人)察觉到

value.def: If something comes to your notice, you become aware of it.

example.ex: Her work also came to the notice of the French actor-producer Louis Jouvet...
example.tran: 她的作品也引起了法国演员兼制片人路易·茹韦的注意。

example.ex: As I write, a very interesting case has come to my notice.
example.tran: 在我写作过程中，一个非常有趣的案例引起了我的注意。

value.def: If something escapes your notice, you fail to recognize it or realize it.

example.ex: It hasn't escaped our notice that the hospital has come out of all the proposed changes really quite nicely...
example.tran: 我们注意到医院很好地兑现了所有拟议的变革举措。

example.ex: From the smallest to the largest production unit, no one escaped notice.
example.tran: 从最小的到最大的生产单位，全都在监控之下。

value.tran: 没有引起…注意;没有被…察觉

value.def: If a situation is said to exist until further notice, it will continue for an uncertain length of time until someone changes it.

example.ex: All flights to Lanchow had been cancelled until further notice.
example.tran: 所有飞往兰州的航班都已取消，何时恢复另行通知。

value.def: If an employer gives an employee notice, the employer tells the employee that he or she must leave his or her job within a fixed period of time.

example.ex: The next morning I telephoned him and gave him his notice.
example.tran: 第二天早晨我给他打了电话，通知他已被解雇。

value.def: If you hand in your notice or give in your notice, you tell your employer that you intend to leave your job soon within a set period of time.

example.ex: He handed in his notice at the bank and ruined his promising career.
example.tran: 他向银行提出了辞职，毁掉了自己的大好前程。

value.def: If you take notice of a particular fact or situation, you behave in a way that shows that you are aware of it.

example.ex: We want the government to take notice of what we think they should do for single parents...
example.tran: 我们希望政府能够关注单亲父母，为他们做一些应该做的事。

example.ex: This should make people sit up and take notice.
example.tran: 这件事应引起人们的关注。

value.def: If you take no notice of someone or something, you do not consider them to be important enough to affect what you think or what you do.

example.ex: They took no notice of him, he did not stand out, he was in no way remarkable...
example.tran: 他们没在意他，他并不突出，一点也不引人注目。

example.ex: I tried not to take any notice at first but then I was offended by it.
example.tran: 起初我尽量不予理会，但后来我被惹恼了。

trans: 没有事前通知，未经通知
注意；注意到；引起注意；关注
通知…离职;给…解雇通知；预先通知；发出解雇通知；递交辞呈
按事先通知的；被关照过的；唯有在被告知
通知；便条；临时通知；短期的通知；短时间内
在短时间内；临时通知；忽然; 急忙；即刻；在很短的时间内

rootsaffixes.indicate: = to know, mark 知道；标记
rootsaffixes.title: not

partsOfSpeech.dec: an 加强 + not 知道；标记 + ate 做 → 做标记 → 注解
an 加强 + not 知道；标记 + ation 行为，过程，状态，结果 → 注解
de 加强 + not 知道；标记 + e → 做标记 → 指示
not 知道；标记 + able …的 → 加了标记的 → 值得注意的
not 知道；标记 + ice 表行为 → 使知道；做标记引起注意 → 注意；通知
not 知道；标记 + ify 使… → 使…知道 → 通知
not 知道；标记 + ion 表名词 → 为让人知道而表达的自己的见解和观点 → 见解；观念
not 知道；标记 + or 表人 + ious 多…的 →〔因做坏事〕让很多人知道 → 恶名昭彰的
avar 渴望 + ice 性质，行为，情况 → 贪婪
coward 胆小鬼 + ice 性质，行为，情况 → 胆怯
crev 裂开 + ice 性质，行为，情况 → 裂缝
just 正义的 + ice 性质，行为，情况 → 正义，公正
mal 坏 + ice 性质，行为，情况 → 恶意
not 知道 + ice 性质，行为，情况 → 知道以后才会引起注意 → 注意
serv 服务 + ice 性质，行为，情况 → 服务
